conclusion: Use properties of triangles, angles of incidence and reflection, and the law of sines or cosines.
Identify given angles: angle A = 90°, angle B = 60°, angle C = 30°.
Using triangle angle sum property, angle C = 180° - 90° - 60° = 30°.
Properties of a 30-60-90 triangle: sides are in ratio 1:√3:2.
If side opposite 30° (BC) is x, then side opposite 60° (AC) is x√3, hypotenuse (AB) is 2x.
EG is perpendicular to AC, triangle EGC is a right triangle, D is midpoint of CG, CD = DG.
Using 30-60-90 triangle properties, if CG = x, then EG = x/2.
EG is perpendicular to AC, triangle EGF is a right triangle.
Angle of deviation is angle between incident light and line from D to F.
Using law of sines in triangle EGF: (EG/sin 60°) = (GF/sin 30°).
Since EG = x/2, GF = x/2, equation becomes (x/2/sin 60°) = (x/2/sin 30°).
Since D is midpoint of CG, CD = DG = x/2 = 2/√3.
Angle of deviation is angle between incident light and line from D to F.
Since EG is perpendicular to AC, angle of deviation is 60°.
